page.syntax: Result_String as C = UI_GET_DATE(C title,C prompt[,C default_choice])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: prompt
argument.description: The descriptive text next to the date field.

argument.name: default_choice
argument.description: A default value to display in the date field.

page.discussion: UI_GET_DATE() creates and displays a dialog box containing a date field. This function is useful for obtaining a valid date. The date you enter or change is returned as a Result_String. You can then convert this string into a date value using the CTOD()function. If the result string is empty (i.e., ""), you pressed the Cancel button and no date value was specified. You define the descriptive text next to the date field with the Caption_Text parameter.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script computes the day on which you were born.
section.example: dim birthday as D date_string= UI_GET_DATE("Birthday", "When is your birthday? ", "11/11/68") if date_string <> "" then birthday = ctod(date_string) ui_msg_box("Happy Birthday!","You were born on a " + cdow(birthday)) end if
